co.cask.cdap.test

Interface AdapterManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAdapterManager

    public interface AdapterManager
    Instance of this class is for managing an adapter.

        co.cask.cdap.proto.RunRecord getRun(String runId)
        Get the run record for a specific run id.

      • waitForStatus

        void waitForStatus(String runId,
                 co.cask.cdap.proto.ProgramRunStatus status,
                 long timeout,
                 TimeUnit timeoutUnit)
                   throws TimeoutException,
                          InterruptedException
        Blocks until a specific run of the adapter has the given status.
        Parameters:
        runId - the id of the run to wait for
        status - the status to block for
        timeout - amount of time units to wait
        timeoutUnit - time unit type
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if timeout reached
        InterruptedException - if execution is interrupted

      • waitForOneRunToFinish

        void waitForOneRunToFinish(long timeout,
                         TimeUnit timeoutUnit)
                           throws TimeoutException,
                                  InterruptedException
        Blocks until a one run of the adapter has finished. If a run has already finished this will return right away. This should not be used on a Worker Adapter without calling stop() first.
        Parameters:
        timeout - amount of time units to wait
        timeoutUnit - time unit type
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if timeout reached
        InterruptedException - if execution is interrupted

      • waitForRunsToFinish

        void waitForRunsToFinish(int numRuns,
                       long timeout,
                       TimeUnit timeoutUnit)
                         throws TimeoutException,
                                InterruptedException
        Blocks until the specified number of runs of the adapter has finished. If that many runs have already finished, this will return right away. This should not be used on a Worker Adapter without calling stop() first.
        Parameters:
        numRuns - the number of runs to wait to finish.
        timeout - amount of time units to wait
        timeoutUnit - time unit type
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if timeout reached
        InterruptedException - if execution is interrupted
